results.title: Hygiene. No. 1. Breathing
results.brief_description: Demonstrates the experiments in the chemical process of burning and oxygenation and illustrates by growing plants, that oxygen is essential for life. Various methods of recording the inhalation and exhalation of breath are explained by animated diagrams.

results.title: Hydroponic gardening step-by-step
results.creator_credit: Practical Hydroponics Magazine and Gary Evans
results.brief_description: Various systems of hydroponics (growing plants without soil) have been used for centuries, from The Hanging Gardens of Babylon to the vegetable growing rafts of the Aztecs. Using hydroponics, plants grow quicker, there are no soil-borne diseases and no weeds. In this video, Gary Evans, editor of Practical Hydroponics Magazine explains in detail and demonstrates the management of nutrient solutions, hydroponic growing media, transplanting from soil to hydroponics, lighting systems, circulating and non-recirculating systems and propagating from cuttings. Includes hydroponics plant guide.

results.title: Hydrogen power
results.brief_description: Looks at the developments and associated problems of using hydrogen as an alternative fuel indicating that hydrogen-fuelled cars look very favourable for the future. The film also shows the problems (and proposed solutions) for the storage of hydrogen, an alternative ways to produce hydrogen.

results.title: Hydrocarbons and their structure
results.brief_description: Laboratory demonstration, animation, and structural and scale models are used to explain the five homologous series of hydrocarbons and to show how members of each series differ from the others.

results.title: Hydraulics
results.brief_description: Explains the principle of hydraulic pressure and shows how liquids are used to transmit power. Simple working models and laboratory experiments visualise the fundamentals of hydraulic pressure, and some of the ways in which it can be utilised.

results.title: Hydatids: a cycle to break
results.brief_description: Illustrates the life cycle of the cyst showing how it is transmitted to humans via dogs who have eaten infected sheep offal. Stresses that efficient disposal of infected sheep offal by farmers can go a long way to preventing the infection of dogs with cysts and that humans should exercise good hygiene habits when handling dogs.

results.title: Hustler white (E)
results.creator_credit: Hustler White productions, Jurgen Bruning, Bruce LaBruce and Rick Castro
results.brief_description: Co-director and star Bruce LaBruce’s sleazy and explicit tour of the LA hustler and porn scene is a humorous and twisted take on Billy Wilder’s “Sunset Boulevard and” the more unsavory moments of “Whatever happened to Baby Jane”. Model Tony Ward stars as Monti- a hustler who becomes the lust object and obsession for Bruce Labruce’s melodramatic journalist, Jurgen Anger. “Hustler White“‘s use of real life hustlers and gay porn actors, along with Labruce’s own gay porn background (he has directed and stared in the underground and very pornographic, Super 8 1/2 and No Skin off my Arse) gives the film a candid documentary feel. Hustler White was co-directed by gay photographer Rick Castro.

results.title: Hush [Widescreen]
results.creator_credit: Victorian College of the Arts and Katherine Fry
results.brief_description: Beginning and concluding at an airport, “Hush” is about a family living in a caravan park who are estranged from one another by a secret, unspoken crime that involves one of the sisters. Cast includes Hayley O’Donnell, Marieke Hardy, Saskia Post and Greg Carroll.

results.title: Hush-a-bye baby
results.creator_credit: Derry Film and Video Workshop, Channel 4, British Screen Finance, Tom Collins and Margo Harkin
results.brief_description: Set in the Catholic community in Derry, Ireland, at the time of the ‘supergrass’ trials in the wake of the abortion referendum in the Republic, this is the story of four teenage girls: Goretti (Emer McCourt); Sinead (Sinead O’Connor); Dinky (Cathy Casey) and Majella (Julie Rodgers). In particular it revolves around their attempts to come to grips with their sexuality in a confusing and oppressive culture. Things come to a head when Goretti becomes pregnant by her boyfriend Ciarin (Michael Liebman), who, meanwhile has been lifted in an army swoop. This is a tough yet wholly sympathetic view of a working class community, a view which whilst touchingly communicating the vulnerability of young people exploring their sexuality, never romanticises the attitudes of its characters toward each other.

results.title: Husbands and wives
results.creator_credit: Tri-Star Pictures, Robert Greenhut and Woody Allen
results.brief_description: A long-time married couple played by Judy Davis and Sydney Pollack astound their friends (Woody Allen and Mia Farrow), by announcing their separation. The film gained notoriety not so much for itself, but because it was the last film that Allen and Farrow made before their own much publicised breakup. Allen uses handheld camera techniques which gives the film a documentary type feel. Judy Davis was nominated for an Academy Award for her performance and Woody Allen for the screenplay. Co-starring Juliette Lewis, Liam Neeson, Blythe Danner, Nora Ephron and Lysette Anthony.
